title: 110_hr7328
content: The "Homeowners' Protection Act of 2008" allows waiver of counseling requirement in foreclosure cases under chapter 13. Additionally, it grants authority to modify certain mortgages. Section 1322(b) of title 11, United States Code, is amended to allow modification of rights for a debt secured by a security interest in the debtor's principal residence, including reducing the claim to match the value of the residence and waiving prepayment penalties. The amendment allows for the modification of a debt secured by a security interest in the debtor's principal residence by adjusting the interest rate and extending the repayment period up to 40 years. The amendment allows for interest accruing after the date of the order for relief under this chapter at an annual percentage rate based on the most recently published annual yield on conventional mortgages by the Board of Governors of the Federal Reserve System, plus a premium for risk. SEC. 4. COMBATING EXCESSIVE FEES. Section 1322(c) of title 11, the United States Code, is amended to state that the debtor, their property, and property of the estate are not liable for fees, costs, or charges incurred during the case related to a debt secured by the debtor's principal residence, unless the claim holder files notice with the court within a specified timeframe. The amended section states that fees, costs, or charges related to a debt secured by the debtor's principal residence are not enforceable unless the claim holder files notice with the court within a specified timeframe. Failure to give notice results in a waiver of any claim for fees, costs, or charges. The amended section states that a plan may waive prepayment penalties on a claim secured by the debtor's principal residence before discharge. SEC. 5. CONFIRMATION OF PLAN. Amends Section 1325(a) of title 11, the United States Code, regarding the modification of a claim holder's rights in a bankruptcy plan. SEC. 6. DISCHARGE. SEC. 6. DISCHARGE. Amends Section 1328 of title 11, the United States Code, to include provisions for payments to holders of claims whose rights are modified under section 1322(b)(11). SEC. 7. EFFECTIVE DATE; APPLICATION OF AMENDMENTS. This Act and its amendments will take effect upon enactment, with the amendments applying to cases under title 11 of the United States Code initiated after the enactment date.
